is.merkor.core.database.data
Class LexicalItem

java.lang.Object
  is.merkor.core.database.data.AbstractPersistentObject
      is.merkor.core.database.data.LexicalItem
All Implemented Interfaces:
PersistentObject, Item, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<LexicalItem>
Direct Known Subclasses:
LexicalItemStub
public class LexicalItem
extends AbstractPersistentObject
implements Item, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<LexicalItem>

Maps to the relation LEXICAL_ITEM in the MerkOr database.

    Attributes:
  • id Long, primary key
  • lexId int, the id from the BIN database (http://bin.arnastofnun.is), necessary for associations, original mapping was made by these ids without different senses
  • senseNr int, the number of sense of this item (from different items having the same lexId and lemma), the combination (lexId, senseNr) is unique
  • lemma String
  • hasMoreSenses boolean, is true if more than one item exists with the same lexId and lemma

    • Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Anna B. Nikulasdottir
    See Also:

    toString

    public java.lang.String toString()
    Returns a string representation of this lexicalItem. It is composed as follows:

    this.getClass().getName() + "[id=" + getId() + ", lemma=" + getLemma() + "_" + getSense() + ", wordclass=" + getWordclass() + "]"

    Overrides:
    toString in class AbstractPersistentObject
    Returns:
    a string representation of this lexicalItem

    compareTo

    public int compareTo(LexicalItem item)
    Compares two lexicalItems. The comparison is primarily based on the lemma attributes, with these being equal, the sense attributes are compared and at last the id. In other words, the default sorting order of lexicalItems is lemma, then sense number and last id.

    Specified by:
    compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<LexicalItem>
    Returns:
    the value 0 if the argument lexicalItem is equal to this lexicalItem; a value less than 0 if this lexicalItem's lemma is less than the argument's lemma, or, these being equal, if this lexicalItem's sense is less than the argument's sense, or, these also being equal, if this lexicalItem's id is less than the argument's id; and a value greater than 0 if this lexicalItem's lemma is greater than the argument's lemma, or, these being equal, if this lexicalItem's sense is greater than the argument's sense, or, these also being equal, if this lexicalItem's id is greater than the argument's id

    equals

    public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
    Compares the specified object with this object for equality. Returns true if and only if the specified object is also a lexicalItem and this.compareTo(lexicalItem2) == 0.

    Overrides:
    equals in class AbstractPersistentObject
    Parameters:

    hashCode

    public int hashCode()
    Returns the hash code value for this lexicalItem. The hash code of a lexicalItem uses the hash code generator of HashCodeBuilder:

    hashCode = new HashCodeBuilder().append(getId()).append(getLemma()).append(sense).toHashCode())

    Overrides:
    hashCode in class AbstractPersistentObject
    Returns:
    the hash code value for this lexicalItem
